meanings.definition: A person who bids more than the current highest bid in an auction.
meanings.sent1: The overbidder won the painting by offering more money than anyone else.
meanings.sent2: The overbidder raised the price of the antique vase significantly.
meanings.sent3: The overbidder accidentally bid too high on the old clock and ended up winning it.
meanings.sent4: In the auction, the overbidder swooped in at the last moment with a surprising offer.
meanings.sent5: The overbidder's strategy was to always outbid others by a small margin to secure the item.

meanings.definition: To bid more than the value of something in an auction.
meanings.sent1: She decided to overbidder on the rare coin to ensure she would take it home.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overbidder on items he really wants, sometimes spending more than planned.
meanings.sent3: The friends joked that he would overbidder on a rock if it was up for auction.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the auction caused her to overbidder on the vintage jewelry piece.
meanings.sent5: Knowing the value of the artwork, she chose to overbidder to secure it for her collection.
